cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.IT, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with combinatorial optimization problems in graphs, such as finding induced matchings and connected matchings. This suggests that the paper may belong to the Discrete Mathematics (cs.DM) category. The paper also discusses hardness of approximation results, which is a common topic in Computational Complexity (cs.CC). The use of bipartite graphs and half-covers suggests that the paper may also belong to the Graph Theory (cs.GT) category. The paper also mentions modeling interference in wireless and communication networks, which suggests that it may belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) category. Finally, the paper discusses information theory and capacity, which suggests that it may also belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) category.
